boat.name: Angele Aline
boat.full_description:
Before the second world war, she fished for cod and ling travelling to Grand Banks, Newfoundland in the summer and the North Sea in the Winter. She took part in the Dunkirk evacuation, rescuing approximately 350 soldiers. She was subsequently used to blockade St Vaast and later Nieuport. After the war, when she was sunk, she was raised and fished until 1963. She was used for chartering in Turkey from December 1980 - 1989 and completely rebuilt 1992 - 1993.

As a yacht she has participated in the tall ships races, won a Cowes Regatta Classics race and received Sail Training Association prizes. She was once again completely rebuilt between 2001 and 2005.

For more information, visit the Association of Dunkirk Little Ships website.
boat.short_description: 'Angele Aline' is a Dunkirk Little Ship and has been sunk as a blockade ship twice, 1940 (St Vaast) and 1944 (Nieuport).
